name: HotSpot Design
blurb: This design involved several iterations of prototyping and running user tests. I experimented with several versions, and ran them by groups of users. I landed on this final design, and made several mockups in Figma.

name: Inside Out Radio Station
blurb: This was the final project for the Architecture class Systems and Materials. In this project, I flipped a physical space I was familiar with, the Columbia Radio Station, inside out. Upon this exploration, I discovered several relationships and connections that I solidified into this model, making considerations on material and construction process.

name: Lunar New Year Poster
blurb: In this poster, I worked on developing my own style, as well as more skills with Adobe Illustrator. I was inspired by maximalist works I had recently seen, and intended to make something that was simultaneously sensorily overwhelming and cohesive.

name: Social System Chair
blurb: This was my first exploration into Architecture. In this project, I identified a social system in my personali life, that of the mailroom line that invovled two queues that crossed each other. I designed this chair to change up that social system, changing the intersection into a round-a-bout type interaction.

name: Got Milk? Poster
blurb: My purpose with this design was to embrace the generational trend toward a more absurdist humor and worldview. Technically, this was an exercise of logo-making and illustrative design.

name: Personal Website
blurb: I designed this website on Figma before developing and deploying it. Here, I worked on the most visually-appealing way to display information I was very familiar with.
